Question: Which one of these situations most closely represents scope creep:
Answer: The scope of the project is clearly agreed upon by the key project stakeholders.
The project scope keeps changing and team members are not sure why and the project seems like it will never end.
The project scope changes through the use of a formal change control process.
The project scope was used to create a WBS that was used to create estimates and a schedule.
Correct: The project scope keeps changing and team members are not sure why and the project seems like it will never end.
